author: Nik Brooks
comment: Awesome application and an absolute must have if you have an android wear watch with a speaker. The text to speech is amazing, you can hear who the message/email is from by hearing the name of the application along with a notification sound, who it is from and it reads the whole thing out loud so you don't have even take your phone out of your pocket/bag. It has so many more features than I have mentioned, this the best android wear applications available on the Play Store in my opinion...... excellent!!!

author: Junjie Yu
comment: Hey Dear developer. I currently have a Sony smartwatch 3. The app just say updating your watch forever and ever. It used to work fine but after an update it just stop working. Can we have a fix please:)

author: Mike Healey
comment: I have a Huawei watch 2. I installed this app because I wanted BOTH sound and vibration for text messages. The app did initally helped with vibration but I could not get it to provide audible notification for messages. I sent 2 emails to app support informing them of the problem and requesting assistance to remedy it. They never returned my calls.   I uninstalled the app and then reinstalled it. This time I got the audible and vibrations to work for messages received and reminders that I set. I have given the app 4 stars because of support's failure to respond to my two emails. It took a lot of work to get this to work for me to provide both Audible and vibratory notification for selected apps.  I have contributed $ to support this app.  ADDENDUM: I got the app to work by uninstalling and reinstalling it on BOTH my phone and watch. Works perfectly now no thanks to watch support. They never did respond to my emails.

author: shanechar111
comment: I like how the notifications are customizable. The LG Watch Style has very weak vibrations, so I kept missing notifications. However, now I get a whole bunch of phantom vibrations. Buzz, buzz, with nothing. Went on all last night, so I am uninstalling.

author: Salad Fatoosh
comment: After searching high and low I am finally able to have custom ringtones and notifications on my watch. Yippie and yahoo. Oh yeah. Another F.U. to Google for making it so difficult to get custom sounds on watches. Now for movies on the watch😷

author: Jim T
comment: No longer works as of Wear 2.0 despite installing app on watch and setting apps to vibrate. An essential app is now utterly useless, which is a huge shame.

author: Joe D'Marco
comment: I bought the zenwatch2 because it had sound especially for hearing calls. I thought the notifications sounds were automatic in the phone but I guess I'm wrong. I read the reviews and glad I installed. Now I can hear by sound what is coming in even before looking at the watch. Text, mail etc.

author: Peter James
comment: I just wanted to say thanks for this app, particularly for the TTS feature. As a previous user of SWN I really missed that functionality. Now I've got it back and I'm very happy. So, thanks for adding this feature, so useful!

author: Melli Avery
comment: It's a great idea behind this but i still have the problem that there's always a extra vibration after the custom one. I already turned everything of in WhatsApp but the watch still does it's pre-set-vibration or at least I think that is the problem.

author: Terry Lobo
comment: I wanted sounds for notifications since Zenwatch 3 vibrate is very soft. This app solved my problem.

author: Hedgie Hog
comment: UPDATE 4: Found that clearing the watch app's data suddenly made the phone app work (sounds, vibrations were sent to the watch)... but only for around 15 minutes. Then watch fell silent again. NB: uninstalling/reinstalling either apps didn't work. Clearing both the watch & phone's data though (and then reprogramming all my settings again) made things work again. Going OK for 12 hours so far. UPDATE 3: Custom vibrations, sounds & TTS no longer working on the watch. UPDATE 2: Suddenly sounds are enabled now. Boy, this is some effort to get working. PREVIOUS UPDATE: the apps title is misleading. It is NOT CLEAR that TTS is not available in the free version (TTS suddenly sprang to life after I'd paid for premium). Description & English needs some work - if I'm mistaken then it's  another big/anomaly ... this app has quite a few of them. Finally got TTS to work, but sounds do not play (app says my watch does not support sounds ... yeah, it REALLY does) - Huawei 2. ORIGINAL: Whilst my Watch IS able to speak (eg via TTS/TalkBack tests) this app fails to speak when a notification arrives. The vibration patterns work ok, but there is no TTS NOTIFICATION and no media/sound notifications. In the phone app the Sounds Manager fails to play any sounds. Is this a related problem? App has permission to read notifications, the Watch companion app is installed and several "Installed Apps" have their pattern/sound set... but the Watch fails to read any TTS notifications. Shame... I was about to pay money :(

author: jim ballantyne
comment: TTS voice is breaking up really bad nearly inaudible on Hauwei smart watch 2 sport emailed but no response from Dev hope there's a fix soon when that happens will go back to 5 Stars

author: noelkilljoy
comment: This app is amazing! This should be the first app to download for Android Wear. It has lots of customisable options such as vibrations and sounds that will make your Android Wear experience great 😊

author: John Francis Reilly
comment: Love this app. Had issues after an update but restarted watch and phone and it seemed to sort it out.

author: Evrim Gurel
comment: I got premium hoping I could add a custom vibration letting me know the watch battery is low (as I often forget to charge my watch), unfortunately my fossil q doesn't have sound and the app has no option to add vibration alerts to battery activity :( Big disappointment

author: Robert Warren III
comment: My watch is cheap or this app is bogus and the developers don't know what they are doing

author: Landon Abbott
comment: I love the app but I annoyingly get two notification sounds for a text.  One when I initially receive a text and a other one when I open it on my phone for some reason.  Can you fix that please?

author: David Yonts
comment: Says connected watch doesn't support sounds even though I know it does. ZTE Quartz

author: Pedro Garcés
comment: Doesn't work, don't pay for it

author: Cloud Galaxy
comment: Don't work on Sony Smartwatch 3

author: James Vande Berg
comment: Works as advertised moto 360 v2

author: Jamie MacFarlane
comment: Wow this app is a must have for watches with a speaker. Doing what Google should have done.

author: Dree Darden
comment: No problems so far on my Huawei watch

author: Slick L
comment: Very good notification app for my watch

author: Rusty B
comment: Everything worth while behind pay wall

author: Darren Lean
comment: Perfect for what I need

author: Diana Palmeri
comment: Simple to use

author: Gareth Grove
comment: Good

author: mark zipeure
comment: Brilliant

author: Leo Wong
comment: This is a fantastic app, especially the sound notifications because my Huawei Smartwatch 1's vibration motor is rather weak.  The key to get the sound feature to work is to go to the watch's PlayStore app and install the Feel The Wear app after you've installed the app on your Android phone.  If the sound doesn't work, then re-install the app on your watch.

author: Chris Zewatski
comment: Watch Screen on, Phone Screen on, and Watch charging are all set to silent when set, but I still get vibration EVERYTIME. Really annoying that I get a vibration when I'm using my watch,phone or even when my watch is charging.

reply.author: Martin Florek
reply.content: Hello. Muting of vibrations is for vibrations played by my app only, for more information and solution how to really mute an app, check this Google+ post https://plus.google.com/110234199301708624596/posts/FGC8ih1hVst Regards.

author: Natalie Brash
comment: Just installed the app and so far so good but will keep you posted.. Now it has stopped working on my watch with no vibration

author: Gavin Woodall
comment: Not reliable. I have a galaxy s6 edge and Huawei watch. After install the watch became sluggish and took 10 or so seconds to respond to button or gestures. Compounded by the fact that 9 times out of 10, I would get no indication that they were out of range of each other. It also seemed to break the find my phone app built into the watch.

reply.author: Martin Florek
reply.content: Hello. The latest Android Wear updated caused some issue to some of my users but it stabilized after few days. Can you contact me via email please, because these replies can be short only. Thank you and regards.

author: Rhys Johnson
comment: Edited after deeper investigation.  Don't make me rate to restore! I stand corrected. The device must be in portrait mode to see the button. In landscape all you see is the rate button and it won't scroll. I revise to a well deserved 5!

reply.author: Martin Florek
reply.content: Hello. Thank you for letting me know about the landscape UI issue. I will improve it in the future. Regards.

author: Chris
comment: Amazing app. Didn't hesitate to pay full price to unlock the absolute abundance of options that my Huawei W1 didn't have. Much customise, many choice!

author: Rebecca Mallo
comment: Love it! Easy to understand and set up. Works like a charm! Dev is super awesome and fast to respond if you have questions.

author: James Gerber
comment: Can't get it to work on LG Style.

reply.author: Martin Florek
reply.content: Hello. Contact me via email with more information please. What is the app doing instead of what it should? There are several causes why the app can stop working after some time. Check this Google+ post for solutions https://plus.google.com/110234199301708624596/posts/5qk9HqGG1Nd Regards.

author: Lazlo Kun
comment: Thx, it's a great app, usefull, handy. I have Huawei Watch and the app work well ;D

author: Chris Wellings
comment: Brilliant app. Does what Wear should do natively.

author: Scott Knappen
comment: Can't imagine using the watch without this app. Zen watch3
